intro: Alsophila coursii, commonly known as the Coursii tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant has a robust rhizome system that allows it to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Its fronds can grow up to several meters in length, contributing to its dramatic appearance in the understory of tropical forests. Alsophila coursii plays a significant ecological role by providing habitat and shelter for various forest organisms.
